title: Honoring Russ Crispell of Tonawanda, New York, upon the occasion of his induction into the Buffalo Tennis Hall of Fame
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  honoring  Russ Crispell of Tonawanda, New York,
upon the occasion of his induction into the Buffalo Tennis Hall of Fame

WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to recognize  and  pay
tribute to those exemplary athletes, coaches and administrators who have
distinguished  themselves  through  their  outstanding  commitment,  and
attained  unprecedented  success  and  the  highest  level  of  personal
achievement; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body is justly proud to honor Russ
Crispell of Tonawanda, New York, upon the occasion of his induction into
the Buffalo Tennis Hall of Fame on Sunday, January 2, 2011; and
  WHEREAS, Russ Crispell's outstanding efforts to the Western  New  York
Tennis  Community  for over 30 years includes being named head coach for
the University of Buffalo men's tennis team between 1993-2006; under his
direction, the team finished second in the ECAC Championships  in  1993;
and
  WHEREAS, Among Russ Crispell's accomplishments in tennis include being
named  the United States Professional Tennis Association Eastern College
Coach of the Year in 1997 and  the  United  States  Professional  Tennis
Registry Eastern College Coach of the Year; and
  WHEREAS,  Russ  Crispell  was a manager and coordinator for the Tennis
for the World University Games in Buffalo between 1989-1993; a recipient
of the 2004 University of  Buffalo  Service  Excellence  Award,  he  has
served  on  many  advisory  committees for the University of Buffalo and
within the local community; and
  WHEREAS, From 1987-1990, Russ Crispell had served as head tennis coach
for the University of Buffalo's women's tennis team; during his  tenure,
the teams became conference champions in 1987 and 1988; and
  WHEREAS, A tennis professional at the Miller Tennis Center, Russ Cris-
pell  is currently the Director of Outdoor Pursuits/Assistant Recreation
Director and Lecturer at the University of Buffalo; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body that  when  individ-
uals  of  such  noble aims and accomplishments are brought to our atten-
tion, they should be celebrated and recognized by all  the  citizens  of
the great State of New York; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor Russ Crispell of Tonawanda, New York, upon  the  occasion  of  his
induction into the Buffalo Tennis Hall of Fame; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Russ Crispell.
